Please - at minimum conduct a Google search before spewing out misinformed garbage.

FLAC is in fact lossless and thus for all practical uses identical to the source. That being said, in double blind "tests" it is damn near impossible to distinguish from a properly encoded mp3 and a FLAC. Don't be seduced by "full" stereo. Joint-stereo increases quality if anything. When you set a max bit-rate while encoding essentially you allocate a finite amount of data per "frame".  Encoding in full stereo essentially splits that data in two - for each channel, even if said data is identical. Joint-stereo intelligently looks at each channel and encodes separate channels only where the two differ, thus saving space and allowing more data to be saved per "frame". More data in this case means higher quality. 

That being said, I prefer FLAC so that I can make my own conversions to mp3 from a quality source. Props to the uploader, good quality torrent.
